headline.main: Keeping Score: Championship Factors for Giants and Patriots

docs.snippet: With an eye toward sports psychology concepts and quantitative analysis that attempts to identify factors that are as independent from one another as possible, five key statistical factors were identified that help predict Super Bowl winners....
docs.abstract: With an eye toward sports psychology concepts and quantitative analysis that attempts to identify factors that are as independent from one another as possible, five key statistical factors were identified that help predict Super Bowl winners.

byline.original: By CARLTON J. CHIN and JAY P. GRANAT

docs.lead_paragraph: Carlton Chin, a fund manager, and Jay Granat, psychotherapist, are authors of "Who Will Win the Big Game? A Psychological & Mathematical Method." They have previously written about the World Series and the N.C.A.A. men's basketball tournament, Super Bowl 44 and Super Bowl 45.

docs.snippet: Why are people drawn to zoos? Among other reasons, it may be the special kind of innocence they hope to find there....
docs.abstract: Why are people drawn to zoos? Among other reasons, it may be the special kind of innocence they hope to find there.

docs.snippet: Why are people drawn to zoos? Among other reasons, it may be the special kind of innocence they hope to find there....
docs.abstract: Why are people drawn to zoos? Among other reasons, it may be the special kind of innocence they hope to find there.
docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN the Warsaw Zoo was bombed during World War II, killing most of the animals, the zookeepers devised a dangerous plan: they decided to use the cages and enclosures to hide more than 300 Jews who were fleeing the Nazis. Their refuge became one of the most successful hide-outs of the war.

headline.main: Everything Indy: Jim Irsay's Museum Pieces

docs.snippet: Iconic guitars, Kerouac’s original manuscript for “On the Road,” and a signed Warhol soup can — all artifacts collected by Indianapolis Colts owner Jim Irsay — are on display at the Indiana State Museum....

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican nominating train is in new terrain: the West. Saturday's caucus in Nevada will unfold against mountains and deserts, a far different backdrop from the first four states.

byline.original: By JEFF Z. KLEIN and STU HACKEL

docs.lead_paragraph: Although concussions have received most of the attention over the last couple of years, injuries of all sorts can deeply influence the performance of N.H.L. teams.
